items.title: India is one of the most active markets in Asia for KKR: Scott Nuttall, co-CEO
items.summary: Global private equity giant KKR is strategically planning a ‘dramatic’ increase in its India investments, aiming for the local market's activity to eventually mirror its global profile.

items.title: KKR Global bullish on India; eyes private credit and real estate for next phase of growth
items.summary: Having invested $9 billion in India over the last five years, KKR expects that number to rise sharply as India’s economy scales up

items.title: Non-US markets make up for loss of exports for India
items.summary: India's export diversification strategy is yielding positive outcomes.  Exports of cotton readymade garments are increasing to the UAE, France, and Japan.  Marine products and certain gems and jewellery are also finding new markets.  This shift helps cushion the impact of US tariffs.  India's overall merchandise exports saw growth in September.

items.title: NHAI monetisation plans in fast lane with new offerings
items.summary: The National Highways Authority of India is accelerating its asset monetisation efforts to meet a ₹40,000-crore target for 2025-26. Following a slow start, NHAI plans to launch its fifth infrastructure investment trust (InvIT-5) and a public InvIT next month, alongside offering six toll-operate-transfer (TOT) bundles to investors.

items.title: India-New Zealand FTA: Fourth round of negotiations begin
items.summary: India and New Zealand have commenced their fourth round of Free Trade Agreement negotiations in Auckland, focusing on trade in goods and services, and rules of origin. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is set to meet his New Zealand counterpart this week to review the ongoing progress. Both nations aim to resolve outstanding issues for an early conclusion of the FTA.

items.title: Manufacturing activity picks up in October on GST relief, tech investments
items.summary: October marked a notable surge in India's manufacturing activity, largely powered by revitalized domestic demand stemming from GST reforms. With an influx of new orders, manufacturers ramped up hiring, reflecting a confident outlook for the future. Though input prices softened, the heightened demand resulted in rising output prices, hinting at a promising trajectory for India's industrial growth.

items.title: India, EU begin talks to resolve key issues in proposed bilateral free trade agreement
items.summary: India and the European Union are holding talks to finalize a free trade agreement. Discussions focus on trade in goods, services, and other key areas. European negotiators are in Delhi for these important discussions. Both sides aim for a balanced and equitable framework. This engagement reaffirms a commitment to a comprehensive trade deal.

items.title: Digital units of public banks to undergo review
items.summary: The government is gearing up for a comprehensive review of digital banking units with the goal of amplifying financial inclusion and simplifying customer interactions. These innovative units will aid in efforts such as regular customer verification and reclaiming unclaimed assets.

items.title: Gold buying by central banks up 10% in Q3
items.summary: Investments in digital gold such as ETFs and similar products rose to 221 tonnes, up 134% on year, says WGC Report.

items.title: ET Graphics: AIFs emerge as major players in India's real estate investment scene
items.summary: Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs) have become the primary capital source for India's real estate sector, anchoring nearly 80% of category II commitments.  These funds are vital for reviving stalled projects, supporting mid-income housing, logistics, and developer credit, with total commitments reaching Rs 14.2 lakh crore as of June 2025.

items.title: Guts, glory & afterglow of the Women's World Cup: It's her story and brands will let her tell it
items.summary: India's World Cup victory has significantly boosted women's cricket commercially. This win marks a turning point, transforming the sport into a valuable, standalone property for brands. Player endorsements are set to rise, and dedicated sponsorships are expected. The sport is now seen as a mainstream attraction, attracting new sponsors and driving growth across the ecosystem.

items.title: I-T drops ₹8,500-crore transfer pricing case against Vodafone Group
items.summary: The Income-Tax Department has withdrawn a significant ₹8,500-crore transfer pricing case against Vodafone Group. This case involved the sale of Vodafone India's call centre business. The withdrawal follows a recent Supreme Court decision regarding Vodafone's adjusted gross revenue liabilities. The dispute had been pending for several years. The Bombay High Court had previously ruled in favour of Vodafone India Services.

items.title: SC upholds CESTAT ruling, rejects ₹244-cr service tax and penalty demand on Airtel
items.summary: The Supreme Court has delivered a decisive blow to the tax department's efforts, rejecting a service tax demand of ₹119 crore plus penalties against Bharti Airtel. The tax officials had aimed to charge the company for call allowances waived for its employees, but the court reaffirmed an earlier tribunal's decision that dismissed these demands.

items.title: Raise the bar: Delhi govt's new excise plan pours in premium choices
items.summary: Delhi's government is finalizing a new liquor policy. Premium liquor brands will soon be available at government vends. Exclusive beer bars may also open in the capital. The policy aims to make premium brands competitively priced. It will also impose excise duty on Bhutanese and Nepalese beer. The drinking age is expected to remain 25 years.

items.title: Nayara imports rebound on Russian supply
items.summary: Nayara Energy saw a significant increase in crude oil imports during October. This surge was entirely from Russia, compensating for previous supply disruptions. The company has ramped up refinery operations to 85-90 percent capacity. Fuel exports have also resumed, reaching new destinations like Brazil and Turkey, despite overall volumes remaining lower than usual.

items.title: Russian oil flows to India set to surge ahead of US sanctions
items.summary: Indian refiners are set to receive more Russian crude oil in November. This surge is driven by the approaching deadline for US sanctions on certain Russian entities.  Meanwhile, US crude supplies to India have significantly increased, becoming the fourth-largest source.  This rise is attributed to favorable economics and a wider price difference between Brent and WTI crude.

The company will establish a new manufacturing unit in Shendra MIDC, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Nagar. This move marks one of the largest industrial land transactions this year. The facility will be Aisin's second plant in India.

It prevents speculation from disrupting legitimate commercial transactions and safeguards banks' reputations and operations.
